markdownText.value: Core `Pure` (coressponding to `###Pure` section in `Pure`) concerns with fundamental modelling concepts, such as, classes (data models), enumerations, associations, functions, etc.

`Mapping DSL` (coressponding to `###Mapping` section in `Pure`) concerns with data transformation specifications: this includes model-to-model transformation, store specification to model transformation, etc.
`External Store Relational DSL` (coressponding to `###Relational` section in `Pure`) concerns with mappings, connections, and specifications for relational databases

es-relational.grammar.parser.title: What is External Store Relational DSL about?

markdownText.value: A `Class` specifies a data model's structure, inheritance, and constraints
A `Profile` provides a generic extension mechanism for customizing existing data models; some of its uses include documentating and classifying data models
An `Enumeration` specifies the complete list of value that a given type may acquire
An `Association` specifies a linking between between 2 data models
A `Function` specifies a piece of reusable Pure code logic
A `Mapping` specifies a transformation between models, including model-to-model, store-to-model, enumeration-to-model, etc.
A `Database` specifies the structure (schema, table, view) and joins of a relational database

A `domain-specific language` (DSL) is a higher-level abstraction optimized for a specific domain/class of problems. Each `DSL` often has their own `Pure` sub-grammar, which partition `Pure` code into sections (each starts with a header, such as `###Pure`, `###Mapping`, etc.
